You guys may or may not be chatting about stuff we’ve been kicking around for awhile now. It’s a hard problem to crack, and we’d need to figure out where to slot this in our (pretty huge) priority list :slightly_smiling_face:
:thumbsup: Just so you all know, we generally see and hear your ideas and chat about them internally. We just try not to say anything unless we can really commit to something (this included)
<@UA886MF42> Is there a roadmap for features you are looking at working on at the moment we obviously get updates when new stuff comes out but it would be cool to see whats in the pipe

Ehh probably not. It’s another thing where we wouldn’t want to promise something that we couldn’t deliver. Things are fluid, priorities change, and the last thing we would want to do is tell you all something was coming and then not deliver for you.
Have already been impressed with how involved HubSpot staff are engaging with the community, is far better than most software.

That's fair wasn't thinking of a set timescale of stuff but more like a monthly roundup on slack or something
Stuff we are reviewing/discussing
Stuff we are working on
Stuff thats coming soon

Hi Rohan, we do not currently publish a regular update like that but the ideas forum does have statuses. HubSpotters will change the status to one of many statuses to communicate “being considered” ” implemented”  and other statuses.

Right now we are working on ensuring we communicate really well when it comes to features that  are definitely coming, and features that are stable - through the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|developer changelog>.

For less-than stable functionality we are thinking about ways to surface things better. That said being a publicly traded company, we are limited in what we can reveal we are working on ahead of time, and will not be able to disclose everything. Plus sometimes big features are like presents, it’s more fun when they’re a surprise.
